sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
By the Queene. Whereas the Queenes Maiestie, for auoyding of the great inconuenience that hath growen and dayly doeth increase within this her realme, by the inordinate excesse in apparel ... Proclamations. 1597-07-06 England and Wales. Sovereign (1558-1603 : Elizabeth I) Elizabeth I, Queen of England, 1533-1603.
5 leaves
By the deputies of Christopher Barker, printer to the Queenes most excellent Maiestie, [Imprinted at London : 1597]
Imprint from colophon. Against excess in apparel. Sheets 2-4 are signed at the bottom, respectively, "B" (men's apparel), "C" (women's apparel), "D" (more men's apparel); sheet 5 (more women's apparel) has the issue date of 6 July and imprint. The unaccustomed men/women alteration may point to some confusion in printing.--STC. Reproduction of the original in the Bodleian Library.
=======

5 leaves
By the deputies of Christopher Barker, printer to the Queenes most excellent Maiestie, [Imprinted at London : 1597]
Imprint from colophon. Against excess in apparel. Sheets 2-4 are signed at the bottom, respectively, "B" (men's apparel), "C" (women's apparel), "D" (more men's apparel); sheet 5 (more women's apparel) has the issue date of 6 July and imprint. The unaccustomed men/women alteration may point to some confusion in printing.--STC. Reproduction of the original in the Bodleian Library.

the deputies of Christopher Barker
